snippet: Psychiatrists are less likely than doctors in other specialties to accept insurance, researchers have found, complicating the push to increase access to mental health care.
abstract: Study published in journal JAMA Psychiatry finds that only 55 percent of psychiatrists accept private insurance, compared with 89 percent of other doctors, complicating push to increase access to mental health care.
lead_paragraph: Psychiatrists are less likely than doctors in other specialties to accept insurance, researchers have found, complicating the push to increase access to mental health care.

headline.main: Fewer Psychiatrists Seen Taking Health Insurance
headline.print_headline: Fewer Psychiatrists Seen Taking Health Insurance
